description: Learned borrowing from Latin lētālis (“deadly, mortal, fatal”), improperly written lēthālis, from lētum (“death”), improperly written as lēthum, from a supposed connection with Ancient Greek λήθη (lḗthē, “oblivion, forgetfulness”).

adjectives.description: lethal (comparative more lethal, superlative most lethal)

entries.meaning: Of, pertaining to, or causing death; deadly; mortal; fatal.
(genetics) An allele that causes the death of the organism that carries it.

description: Abbreviation of “lauric acid ethereal salt”, so called because it occurs in the ethereal salt of lauric acid.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) One of the higher alcohols of the paraffine series obtained from spermaceti as a white crystalline solid.
